review: Been to this location several times and sat at both the bar for happy hours and in the regular part of the place.  Food always served correctly and they give me extra honey mustard and Jack Danial sauce as requested. Quick note guys don't take your girl there on a date. My ex hated the attention the waitresses would give me, but I mean everyone get the same treatment so I call it good customer service. They even had live music last time I went there. Overall I like the place, food prices and all.

My Wife and I went here around Christmas time and the place was surprisingly empty during happy hour! Neither of us even knew this little shopping center was here, we literally stumbled upon it one night. The service was lighting fast, the waitress was very friendly and helpful (this is part of the happy hour menu, but this is not, etc.) the food tasted great, the drinks were very strong and we really enjoyed ourselves! Sorry Chili's and Applebee's...we found a new hangout.

I love this restaurant. For starters,  it is located near a shopping center so you can get your shopping done and eat here when your finished.  Me and my boyfriend come here as often as we can.   I love the Jack Daniel's Chicken & Shrimp. Wooo the sauce is unbelievable tasty.  Whenever I go out to eat I hardly ever finish whats on my plate but this place is so good that I finish every bite.  They have great deals. 2 for $20,  which is a 3 course meal.   Customer service is great, they always come and check on you, making sure you enjoy your meal.   When people ask me what they should have for lunch/dinner I simply tell them Fridays!

o.k. So  TGIF you have have insulted me in person for one day,I will hurt you on yelp forever. Today was my second time at this location.The first time was a bad experience and so was this time.The food is not bad or awful just plain.The food is nothing special.The service sucks.They forget about the customers and then do not give the correct change.I was robbed at this place by my waitress.Not just me also the others in the group I was in as well .The waitress messed the charges up so she would pocket extra cash. THIS PLACE IS A RIPOFF THEY CHARGE PEOPLE AT THE BAR TO PAY FOR SITTING THERE AND WATCHING A  LAKER GAME.THE WAITRESSES STEAL FROM THE CUSTOMERS.AVOID THIS PLACE AT ALL COSTS.
Not a fan of Fridays. Especially not their food. I do like gheir happy hour prices on drinks. Have no complaints with service. Everyone was polite. Not bad for the hood.

I went here for lunch with my sister and her co-worker just to have some lunch , at around 11:00am.  Food was great , but service is horrendous ! We had to wait half an hour for the food, and the server was by the name Carney.  Poor hospitality skills , and showed no motivation when servicing us.  Acted almost like he didn't care about our service. The worst part was asking for our bill. It took half an-hour to get our bill, and we we did get it, we were billed wrong. We did the 2 for $10 special. Instead of giving us 2 for $10, we were billed for each item individually, and had requested it get corrected. That took another whole long time. At any rate, the food is great! It's a nice place to come to for food, but service is horrible. You also risk getting your appetizers being cold, due to the lack of skill the servers have. (My french fries were cold, but I didn't complain.) Go to a different TGIF, or go to the Ono BQQ right across the street. You'll be stuck here in this place for over an hour due to their services. And even mis-charged. Make sure to carefully view your bills here, otherwise they will try and rip you off. Never coming here again.

I give this Restaurant a Negative Star  First of all service sucks as soon we walked in!!!   This place is something else  they have a dress code rules posted on the wall maybe because is City of Compton lol  My family and I ended up going to Lucille's Smokehouse BBQ in Cerritos, CA . Got a better service and satisfied.

Went here last Friday around 5pm.  Initial Reactions: Restaurant was easy to find, parking was a little weird, but free and the front of house was polite and quickly sat the both of us. The restaurant was clean, the bar was busy, but the rest of the restaurant was not very busy. I'd say 30-40% full. Time: 10 mins since seating. NO SERVER APPROACHES US. I had to finally ask someone to serve us and they hesitantly did so only after "checking for our server". He did not know the details of the drinks, even asking us to point to the drinks we were referring to. The order was not complicated, but he didn't seem to understand my questions or the substitution requests I was making. 30 mins since seating. We get our drinks. A full 20 minutes AFTER we order it. I get it. The bar is busy, but seriously. The real server also appears and apologizes, saying he just got on shift and no one told him that he had a table already, even though he many other fellow servers passing our table seemingly ignoring us. 35 mins since seating a liquid explodes from the bus boy station near us. I'm not sure what that area is used for , but  It looks like a bus boy station so I'm worried that this massive explosion of liquid is dirty water or something worse. The hot liquid splatters over my table and three other tables. Two families near us are also startled by it. The employee in the bus boy station sees me literally wiping myself after the explosion he caused and quickly leaves the station. Two other serves pass me, not noticing their customers cleaning their respective tables.  I had to call for a supervisor. I point to the splattered liquid on the floor, the windows of the bus boy station and the tables. He apologizes and says he will find out what the liquid was.  5 minutes later, he says it's water and instructs his employees to clean the bus boy station. Bus boy station clean now. Customer tables and customers not. I think he realizes this so he says he will get me something to wipe myself with. 5 minutes later he comes back. No joke.  40 min since seating. By now you must be wondering how I can be so accurate about  the time since we sat... that's because I've been checking my watch constantly. We have not received the two appetizers we had ordered (drum roll) till now. Two appetizers.  We had finished our drinks by then so I ordered another round of drinks. In closing. We got our second drinks AFTER we finished our appetizers. So it gave us enough time to think about what type of tip we should leave. The manager comes and says the appetizers were on the house because of the earlier incident with the hot water, which was a nice gesture. We were in a rush since this quick meal turned out to be nearly a two hour ordeal, so we paid the bill and left.  The only problem was they didn't leave the credit card with the bill. We didn't realize they didn't give us back our credit card until the next day. We had to drive back to this hell hole to pick it up...  Food Excellent Service Horrible

This place is alright, nothing special. Standard Friday's experience. My favorite dish is the firecracker shrimp for $9.99. You get a plate full of breaded shrimp covered in a sweet and slightly spicy sauce with coleslaw. Add a drink or two and you're good to go.

Service is horrible I will never eat here again. Shavonn the server was rude and throwing the plates around. Also charged the table next to us on my card and almost handed them my debit card. She did not credit the additional charge and when I called to complain to the manager and demand a refund for the extra charge there was no answer at 12:30 Pm. I know they are open for lunch. I should of read the other reviews for the service I will stick to the ones in Torrance where the service is better.
Not my favorite place to eat.. Service wasn't bad, brownie was great, but steak was pretty unimpressive.

Only willing to do this location Fridays for Happy Hour and I have to be out for here by 5 pm! At 5 pm you seem to becmoe invisible and will need lots of luck flagging down the waiter. Heaven forbin you want a water!!

A-ok Friday's.  While on a quick stay in Carson I needed to get some reliable chain food with a friend. Service was fine. Wings-good. Burger-average. Shrimp-average. Nothing out of the ordinary here. Nice and consistent. I actually liked the layout of this location.

If you want a nice place for Happy Hour, this is the joint.  The bar area and very customer friendly and it is definitely a place where you could sit tthe bar and makea new friend or sit in a side booth alone and chill with  familiar friend.  The food is cool, because during happy hour, 97% of the appetizer menu is half price, except for the large platters.  I understand why, because if it was, I would order 2.
This has got to be the worst service I have ever had the waiter was rude and the whole staff seemed to be horrible at their job even the mangers I decided not even to eat there ever again

Went here last night with my boyfriend.  arrived - was quickly seated , reception nice and friendly Waitress arrived soon after took our drink orders and returned with them promptly. Took us a while to decide (this place is kinda price and i am kinda cheap:)  looked ta the 2 for 20 stuff no g there, order jack daniels ribs with cajun shrimp and it came with a free appetizer of warm queso with chips! woo hoo my boyfriend had cheesy chicken skillet with shrimp. all of our food was amazingly delicious and fresh and perfect even the veggies were tasty and seasoned just right, yum ! i just wish i had enough room for desert, it was awesome my waitress was good, another lady there who wasnt even our server came to our table and checked on us brought extra napkins and was attentive. no complaints at all.  everything was perfect and i left happy and had my yummy left overs for lunch today and they were just Delicious! all in all a great experience and will def return.

I'm sorry, but Compton is the WORST place to put a TGI Friday's.  I stopped here to spend time with a friend.  It was 85% empty except for the bar (smh at alchies).  There was NOBODY at the front desk.  Completely understaffed like most hood places (I know this for a fact).  Waitress was ok, but could be better, but it's not her fault that this Friday's sucks.  The food was good to a certain extent, but the service was not Friday's standard.  Of  course the bar HAS to be on point in order to keep the alchies in good spirits.  You're better off at the Long Beach and Ladera Center locations if you want that pure Friday's experience.  The Compton treatment is not worth your time.

Im not a fan of TGIF. Very friendly staff. food did not meet up to its high prices. It took very long time for us to get our meals plus we kept asking the waitress for things n she would forget. I dont think I would go there again!
It's a Friday's they are pretty much all the same.  We were starving and saw the sign off the freeway.  It was really crowded but got seated fast and our server was cool.

Ok, I'm a happy hour lover! This place has two happy hours per day and ALL DAY SUNDAY! On Sundays they offer happy in the entire restaurant not just the bar. Try the wings "dry", trust me, I have converted many people. Get em dry then dip them in your desired sauce. The fries are $1.50 during happy our so of you're broke go to HH at Fridays. You can get an order of wings, fries and an ultimate strawberry margarita (no salt for me) for $12 plus tax. C'mon, where.can you find a deal like that?

Went here on a Sunday with my boyfriend.  We called ahead to find out the times for Happy Hour and they said it was all day!  We ordered the ultimate margaritas which were delicious and only 5 bucks.  Got to watch some sports and the total only came to about 30 bucks for both of us and we were stuffed.  We will definitely go back to eat here again.  Oh and the food was delicious.  Ordered the basket of fries, some sliders, and one of the platters that had mozzarella sticks, onion rings, and wings.

We've been to this TGIF few times before, and we always had relatively pleasant experiences in the past.  Not exactly sure what happened today (perhaps management change?), but this time everything went wrong. 1. we were seated promptly but had to wait an hour for our meal (simple burgers and chickens) 2. they forgot to get us utensils, so we were forced to eat half of our meals with our hands 3. they never refilled our drinks 4. we asked for medium rare burger, but our burger was completely charred 5. they made a mistake and overcharged us on the bill It was rather late lunch, so the place wasn't even that crowded, so I am not sure what happened here.

I am so glad to have a TGIF in my residential area so I reluctantly post my opinion regarding my last visit which was on 5/11/13 at 9:00pm. I had a server who needed training. I was SHOCKED she was going to have me make my own sauce at any case I refused the butter. The server did not come back for a long period of time asked if she could take the place, I was hoping for desert but when I was asking for it she just walked away we was not sure if she heard me or not. I was so disappointed, I had the same meal three weeks prior and it was excellent, service was awesome - so I am thinking management has no idea how much customer service can change our experience.

Worst. Service. Ever. Came here for lunch with co-workers, sat in the bar. A group sat down next to me. 40 minutes later and still waiting for my food, and the group was almost done eating. Stood up, told them I wasn't paying for this OR coming back and left. Never, ever, ever come here for lunch. Or dinner. Not to mention the surly waitress who screwed up the order in the first place! AVOID!!!

i'm a regular here for happy hour 10pm - till close, wings and beer how awesome can this get! love it! just, ah, well is in Compton so expect the crow to be louder than music speakers... just saying... i'll be here on Friday that for sure!

I came here for lunch with my family and the place wasn't very crowded and not too dark either - the ambience was nice, overall. The hostess quickly seated us and we were given our menus. We ordered the loaded skillet nacho chips as an appetizer; for our entrees we chose cheeseburger with sweet potato fries, chicken crusted Parmesan with tortellini, and Jack Daniels prime rib with shrimp scanti with a side order of Parmesan steak fries. For dessert, we ordered the whiskey brownie. The food arrived at good time, everything delicious although the chicken Parmesan was dry and tasted bland. Our waitress was a little slow on things, had trouble remembering our orders and keeping organization, and while she was genial wasn't the staff around. I would come here on a weekday or so when the restaurant isn't very crowded, and just for a lunch too. Parking is decent.
PLEASE go to the one at the LB town center. There is way better service there.

The overall rating says it all. Service here sucks any day (literally). The only thing I like about Fridays is their 2 for $20 and that's about it.  Good luck trying to get some menus. Good luck finding out who your grumpy waiter is! .... food will take forever, finding your waiter will take forever, getting the food will take forever, and getting the check will take FOREVER.

This place sucks after waiting for 35 mins I go to ask if our table was ready just to discover they had skipped my name. And another 25 minutes mins to just get my water. This place is loud and I think they just whispered my name. They also don't  honor the 2 for $20 complete menu as it is on the website they only give you 2 options out of 8 that are on the website.

We were given the typical "sorry we are so busy today" EXCUSE.  hmmm It's Saturday night happy hour, if you're NOT busy then there is something wrong. THEREFORE you should PREPARE for BUSY weekends.  Sort of given.    So I met a friend here and he was already at the bar.  When I walk in he goes out to the car quickly and in the meantime this lady comes around asking did you order these wings?  I tell her I'm not sure, I just got here and maybe my friend did.  She says okay and stands there until my friend comes back.  Welp that wasn't our order.  Whoever got those wings had some cooling off HOT wings as plenty of people passed that plate.  So I figured it was a fluke.  We ordered wings to start, and again here comes the same lady stopping with our plate at EVERY table around the bar and every bar stool to ask, "Did you order wings"  This basically went on the entire time we were here.  So REALLY being busy equates NOT knowing WHO to give orders to?  so I could have taken the wings and happily ate them without anyone knowing.   the LAST straw was when my friend asked for a plate the waitress had the NERVE to say "WHAT?!"  wow.  so "WHAT?!" is how you answer customers who say "Excuse me can I get a plate for the bones"   The FOOD is was VERY good...including my salad...but who KNOWS how many people breathed ALL over it before it got to me.   geesh
This Fridays is awesome. The bar service is excellent and the staff is very polite and knowledgable

Wow.  Been here 2 times.  Felt like giving them a chance after a visit a few months ago with some serious issues. Last night was no better. Let's dive into some details. Service was awesome!  Our waiter was on the ball.  Always checking on us, making sure we were happy.  Quick and reliable.  The problem was that the kitchen couldn't seem to do anything right, and apparently the bar wasn't far behind. We ordered during happy hour, so that entailed appetizers and drinks only since they're 1/2 price.  Our order covered the following:  2 sets of buffalo wings in Jack Daniels sauce with extra sauce on the side...  2 orders of pot stickers.  And a long island iced tea.   First to arrive.  An oddly colored long island.  Tasted strange.  Oh, but the glass had a vertical shatter in it that would have split wide open should we bumped it against the table hard enough.  He gladly took it back for a new drink, but I think the bar just poured it into a new glass and put some ice in it. Second was the food.  Pot stickers came with no dipping sauce at all.  And the wings came out looking particularly undercooked and strangely different amongst the 2 orders.  We quickly determined they forgot all sauces, and one was in Jack Daniels sauce, while the other was in BBQ sauce.  Waiter was quick to fix these issues. Manager was quick to discount.  But my problem lies here:  2 different visits.  2 sets of disasters.   I've been to multiple TGI Fridays and never had trouble, but this one has struck out twice.  Hard to not notice. Visit with this in mind.
Don't know why they have low grades, great for happy hour and food is good. A lil hood but overall it's cool!
Best strawberry margaritas...service is so so depending on how busy they are.
Sunday all day happy hour with the kids. Service was average. But the rating is high because I love Fridays.

Ugh!

Even though this location was in my part of town, I'd be quick to pass it up for a better experience elsewhere!!!"

Worst service ever! Don't even waste ur time. Waitresses and waiters usually favor their "friend" customers over actual paying customers!
